# phare_status_page (Resource)

Manages a Phare status page for displaying uptime information publicly.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Create a monitor to track on the status page
resource "phare_uptime_monitor" "api" {
  name     = "API Endpoint"
  protocol = "http"

  http_request {
    method = "GET"
    url    = "https://api.example.com/health"
  }

  interval               = 60
  timeout                = 5000
  incident_confirmations = 1
  recovery_confirmations = 1
  regions                = ["na-usa-iad", "eu-deu-fra"]
}

# Create a public status page
resource "phare_status_page" "public" {
  name                  = "Example Status Page"
  title                 = "Example Service Status"
  description           = "Current status and uptime for Example services"
  search_engine_indexed = true
  website_url           = "https://example.com"

  # Optional: Use Phare subdomain
  subdomain = "status" # Creates status.phare.io

  # Optional: Custom domain (requires DNS configuration)
  # domain = "status.example.com"

  # Optional: History timeframe
  timeframe = 30 # Show last 30 days (options: 30, 60, 90)

  # Color scheme for different status states
  colors {
    operational          = "#10b981" # Green
    degraded_performance = "#f59e0b" # Amber
    partial_outage       = "#f97316" # Orange
    major_outage         = "#ef4444" # Red
    maintenance          = "#3b82f6" # Blue
    empty                = "#9ca3af" # Gray
  }

  # Components to display on the status page
  components = [
    {
      name       = "API"
      monitor_id = phare_uptime_monitor.api.id
    }
  ]

  # Optional: Custom branding
  # logo    = "/path/to/logo.png"
  # favicon = "/path/to/favicon.ico"
}

# Status page with multiple components
resource "phare_uptime_monitor" "website" {
  name     = "Website"
  protocol = "http"

  http_request {
    method = "GET"
    url    = "https://example.com"
  }

  interval               = 60
  timeout                = 5000
  incident_confirmations = 1
  recovery_confirmations = 1
  regions                = ["na-usa-iad"]
}

resource "phare_uptime_monitor" "cdn" {
  name     = "CDN"
  protocol = "http"

  http_request {
    method = "HEAD"
    url    = "https://cdn.example.com"
  }

  interval               = 120
  timeout                = 5000
  incident_confirmations = 1
  recovery_confirmations = 1
  regions                = ["na-usa-iad", "eu-deu-fra", "as-sgp-sin"]
}

resource "phare_status_page" "comprehensive" {
  name                  = "Multi-Component Status"
  title                 = "Example Platform Status"
  description           = "Real-time status for all Example platform services"
  search_engine_indexed = true
  website_url           = "https://example.com"

  colors {
    operational          = "#00c853"
    degraded_performance = "#ffab00"
    partial_outage       = "#ff6d00"
    major_outage         = "#d50000"
    maintenance          = "#2962ff"
    empty                = "#bdbdbd"
  }

  components = [
    {
      name       = "Website"
      monitor_id = phare_uptime_monitor.website.id
    },
    {
      name       = "API"
      monitor_id = phare_uptime_monitor.api.id
    },
    {
      name       = "CDN"
      monitor_id = phare_uptime_monitor.cdn.id
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `colors` (Attributes) Color scheme for different status states (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--colors))
- `components` (Attributes List) List of monitors to display as components on the status page (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--components))
- `description` (String) Description shown on the status page (2-250 characters)
- `name` (String) Internal name of the status page (2-30 characters)
- `search_engine_indexed` (Boolean) Whether search engines should index this status page
- `subdomain` (String) Subdomain for the status page (e.g., 'status' for status.phare.io, creates {subdomain}.status.phare.io)
- `timeframe` (Number) Number of days of history to display (30, 60, or 90)
- `title` (String) Public title displayed on the status page (2-250 characters)
- `website_url` (String) URL of the website this status page is for (max 250 characters)

### Optional

- `domain` (String) Custom domain for the status page
- `favicon` (String) Favicon file path or URL (ico, png, or svg)
- `logo` (String) Logo file path or URL (jpeg, png, or svg)

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the status page was created
- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the status page
- `updated_at` (String) Timestamp when the status page was last updated

<a id="nestedatt--colors"></a>
### Nested Schema for `colors`

Required:

- `degraded_performance` (String) Color for degraded performance status (hex color code)
- `empty` (String) Color for empty/unknown status (hex color code)
- `maintenance` (String) Color for maintenance status (hex color code)
- `major_outage` (String) Color for major outage status (hex color code)
- `operational` (String) Color for operational status (hex color code)
- `partial_outage` (String) Color for partial outage status (hex color code)


<a id="nestedatt--components"></a>
### Nested Schema for `components`

Required:

- `componentable_id` (Number) ID of the monitor to display
- `componentable_type` (String) Type of component (e.g., 'uptime/monitor')
